title: Add Job Requirements section and navigation anchors (Trustline Financial Services)

requirements.summary: Add a new Job Requirements section to the homepage with professional Credit Card Sales role requirements copy and an anchor id.
acceptanceCriteria: A new section is visible on the home page with a clear H2 heading such as “Job Requirements” or “Credit Card Sales — Job Requirements”.

The section content is written in professional English and includes the key requirements discussed: minimum education (high school; degree preferred), communication skills, basic computer/CRM skills, confidence with customers, target-driven mindset, customer handling, and positive attitude.
The section uses an HTML section anchor id (e.g., id="job-requirements") so it can be linked/scrolled to.
Styling is consistent with the existing site theme (cards/typography/spacing) and responsive across mobile/desktop.

file_operations.description: Create a new homepage section component with <section id="job-requirements"> and an H2 heading (e.g., “Credit Card Sales — Job Requirements”), using shadcn-ui Card/CardContent (and existing typography/spacing patterns) to present professional English copy covering: minimum education (high school; degree preferred), communication skills, basic computer/CRM skills, confidence with customers, target-driven mindset, customer handling, and positive attitude. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the new JobRequirementsSection into the homepage section flow (placed consistently among existing sections) so it renders on the Home page and can be reached via #job-requirements. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add anchor navigation links to the new Job Requirements section from the navbar and footer, matching existing smooth scrolling behavior across Home/Admin pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Navbar includes a “Job Requirements” (or “Careers”) item that scrolls smoothly to the new section when on the Home page.
Footer “Quick Links” includes a matching link that navigates to #job-requirements.
Navigation behavior matches existing section scrolling behavior (works from Admin page by returning to Home then scrolling).

file_operations.description: Add a new navigation item labeled “Job Requirements” (or “Careers”) in both desktop and mobile menus that uses the existing scrollToSection helper to smoothly scroll to the section id "job-requirements", including the existing behavior that navigates back to Home before scrolling when currently on Admin. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update Footer to include a “Job Requirements” item under Quick Links that navigates to "#job-requirements" and matches the existing app behavior: smooth scroll on Home, and when on Admin first navigate to Home then scroll to the target section. Implement this without changing any files under frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire any required props/callbacks from App into Footer (and keep Navbar behavior intact) so footer quick-link navigation can trigger home/admin switching and smooth scroll consistently across pages. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
